Jadi Ketua PSSI, Iwan Bule Tidak Harus Mundur dari Polri
04 Nov 2019, 10:59 by Puga Hilal Baihaqie
JAKARTA, (PR).- Terpilihnya Komisaris Jenderal Polisi Mochammad Iriawan atau yang lebih disapa Iwan Bule sebagai Ketua Umum Persatuan Sepakbola Seluruh Indonesia (PSSI) Periode 2019-2023 tidak serta-merta membuat ia harus mengundurkan diri sebagai anggota Polri. Pencalonan Iwan Bule hingga ia terpilih menjadi Ketua Umum PSSI merupakan haknya sebagai warga negara Indonesia. 
"Setiap orang memiliki hak yang sama untuk menduduki jabatan publik. Terlebih yang bersangkutan juga mengikuti mekanisme pemilihan yang demokratis, transparan dan independen," kata Kepala Biro Penerangan Masyarakat Divisi Humas Polri Brigadir Jenderal Polisi Dedi Prasetyo di Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019. 
Saat ini Iwan Bule merupakan anggota Polri aktif yang bertugas sebagai Sekretaris Utama Lembaga Ketahanan Nasional (Lemhanas) sejak 8 Maret 2019. Lulusan Akademi Kepolisian RI 1984 itu juga sebelumnya pernah menjabat sebagai Kapolda Jawa Barat, Kapolda Metro Jaya hingga posisi strategis lainnya di kepolisian. 
Dengan hadirnya Iwan Bule di PSSI pihak Kepolisian juga berharap ia dapat melakukan berbagai gebrakan di tubuh PSSI terutama dalam memberantas jaringan mafia sepakbola. Sebelumnya Mabes Polri telah menjerat sejumlah oknum petinggi PSSI dalam kasus mafia sepakbola seperti pengaturan skor pertandingan hingga persoalan suap. Di bawah kepemimpinan Iriawan, pihak kepolisian berharap kasus buruk yang pernah menimpa PSSI tak terulang kembali.  
Seperti diketahui dalam Kongres PSSI yang berlangsung tertutup di Hotel Shangri-La Jakarta, Iwan Bule mendapatkan 82 suara dari 85 pemilik suara yang hadir. Dalam voting tersebut terdapat tiga suara tidak sah.
Dalam Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) PSSI yang digelar di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019, pemungutan suara dilakukan 86 voters PSSI. Dari 11 kandidat ketua, Iriawan unggul mutlak dengan raihan 82 suara.
Kongres dengan agenda utama pemilihan Ketua Umum, Wakil Ketua Umum, dan12  Anggota Komite Eksekutif (Exco) PSSI untuk periode 2019-2023 diikuti 86 pemilik suara yang terdiri dari 34 perwakilan Asosiasi Provinsi, 18 klub Liga 1, 16 klub Liga 2, 16 klub Liga 3 hasil dari kompetisi 2018, Federasi Futsal Indonesia, dan Asosiasi Sepak Bola Putri. Selain 82 voters yang memilih Iwan, tiga suara dianggap tidak sah dan satu voters tidak ikut memilih alias walk out yakni perwakilan Persis Solo.
Setelah terpilih, Iwan mengatakan sudah mendapatkan telefon ucapan selamat dari Presiden FIFA, AFC, hingga dari AFF. ***

So Chair of PSSI, Iwan Bule Doesn't Have to Resign from the National Police
Nov 04 2019, 10:59 by Puga Hilal Baihaqie
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The election of Police Commissioner General Mochammad Iriawan or better known as Iwan Bule as Chairperson of the All Indonesian Football Association (PSSI) for the 2019-2023 period does not necessarily mean he has to resign as a member of the National Police. Iwan Bule's nomination until he was elected as General Chair of PSSI is his right as an Indonesian citizen.
"Everyone has the same right to hold public office. Moreover, the person concerned also follows a democratic, transparent and independent election mechanism," said Head of the Public Information Bureau of the Public Relations Division of the National Police Police Brigadier General Dedi Prasetyo in Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Currently Iwan Bule is an active member of the National Police who has served as the Main Secretary of the National Defense Agency (Lemhanas) since March 8, 2019. The 1984 Indonesian Police Academy graduate also previously served as West Java Regional Police Chief, Metro Jaya Regional Police Chief and other strategic positions in the police.
With the presence of Iwan Bule at PSSI, the Police also hopes that he can make various breakthroughs in the body of PSSI, especially in eradicating the mafia football network. Previously the National Police Headquarters had ensnared a number of PSSI officials in the case of the football mafia, such as match fixing and bribery. Under Iriawan's leadership, the police hoped that the bad cases that had befallen PSSI would not be repeated.
As is known in the PSSI Congress which took place closed at the Shangri-La Hotel in Jakarta, Iwan Bule received 82 votes from 85 voters present. There were three invalid votes in the vote.
In the PSSI Extraordinary Congress (KLB) held at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019, voting was carried out by 86 PSSI voters. Of the 11 chairman candidates, Iriawan has an absolute advantage with 82 votes.
The Congress with the main agenda for the election of the Chairperson, Deputy Chairperson, and 12 Members of the PSSI Executive Committee (Exco) for the 2019-2023 period was followed by 86 voters consisting of 34 Provincial Association representatives, 18 League 1 clubs, 16 League 2 clubs, 16 League clubs 3 results from the 2018 competition, the Indonesian Futsal Federation, and the Women's Football Association. In addition to 82 voters who voted for Iwan, three votes were considered invalid and one voter did not participate in the alias walk out, namely the Persis Solo representative.
After being elected, Iwan said that he had received a congratulatory telephone from FIFA President, AFC, and from AFF. ***
